trans-unit.source: Provides information about a row of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell"></xref> objects to accessibility client applications.
Windows Forms includes built-in accessibility support that allows your program to work with accessibility client applications.

Examples of accessibility client applications include screen enlarger and reviewer utilities, voice input utilities, on-screen keyboards, alternative input devices, and keyboard enhancement utilities.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject> class inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> class to provide information about a row of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell> objects to accessibility client applications.

Each class that represents a visual part of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>—such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>—also contains a class that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> to provide information about the containing class and perform actions on behalf of accessibility client applications.

There are instances when you will want to provide additional information, such as the name or description of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control, to accessibility client applications.
There are two ways of providing this additional information.

To provide limited accessibility information for existing controls, set the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleName%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDescription%2A> property values, which will be reported to accessibility client applications.

You should change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDefaultActionDescription%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleRole%2A> property values only in rare situations, such as if you make a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> look like a list.

Occasionally, you might require more accessibility information or different accessibility actions to be included with your custom <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>.

To customize accessibility, you can write your own class that derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewAccessibleObject> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> classes and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method.

For example, if you are writing a custom row header cell that implements unique custom actions, such as special hit testing within your cell, you should create a class that inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject> class and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> exposes its data structure by using <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole> values to define the data table hierarchy.

For more information on exposing data tables to Microsoft Active Accessibility, see "Exposing Data Tables through Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject"></xref> class without setting the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject"></xref> class, setting the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property to the specified value.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject"></xref>
Gets the location and size of the accessible object.
For more information about this property, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject.Bounds%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the bounds of the accessible object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is not set.
Returns the child accessible object corresponding to the specified index.
The order of the child accessible objects that represent a column header corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.DisplayIndex%2A> properties of the columns.
The zero-based index of the accessible child.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> that represents the column header at the specified index.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is not set.
index is less than 0.
Returns the number of children belonging to the accessible object.

The number of child accessible objects that belong to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject> corresponds to the number of visible columns in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.GetChildCount%2A> method includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTopLeftHeaderCell> in the count of child accessible objects.
The number of child accessible objects belonging to the accessible object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is not set.
Gets the name of the accessible object.
The string "Top Row".
Navigates to another accessible object.

The following table describes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> method will return for each parameter value.
Parameter value
Return value
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Next> or
An accessible object that represents the first <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> that is a data row in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.
An accessible object that represents the first column header in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible%2A> property is set to `true`, the accessible object represents the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTopLeftHeaderCell>.
An accessible object that represents the column header for the last visible column.
All other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation> values
`null`.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation"></xref> values.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> that represents the object at the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation"></xref> value.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is not set.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that contains the row of column headers.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that contains the row of column headers.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property has already been set.
Gets the parent of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewAccessibleObject"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is not set.
Gets the role of the accessible object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole.Row"></xref> value.
Gets the value of an accessible object.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Value%2A> property is the same as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewTopRowAccessibleObject.Name%2A> property.
The string "Top Row".
